entry_title: Los Angeles Lakers assign Bronny James to G League team

entry_summary: Paul George was booed in his return to Los Angeles for the first time since leaving the Clippers last summer for the Philadelphia 76ers.

entry_title: Ex-UC Riverside standout Kyle Owens is 'looking for somebody to save my life'
entry_summary: Kyle Owens needs a bone-marrow transplant, and he and his family are hoping people between the ages of 18-40 will take a cheek swab test to see if they're a match.

entry_title: 76ers star Joel Embiid verbally confronts, then shoves, Philadelphia reporter
entry_summary: A visibly angry Joel Embiid shouted at and eventually shoved a Philadelphia newspaper columnist in a locker room altercation after the struggling 76ers lost to the Memphis Grizzlies on Saturday night

entry_title: NBA considering All-Star Game changes again, away from the 'traditional' format
entry_summary: The NBA is considering changing the format for the All-Star Game that will be played in San Francisco later this season, Commissioner Adam Silver said

entry_title: Toronto Raptors retire Vince Carter's jersey in emotional ceremony

entry_title: 76ers' Joel Embiid hits back at angry fans: 'I've done way too much for this city'
entry_summary: Joel Embiid and Paul George will each miss a fifth straight game with left knee injuries when the Philadelphia 76ers host Memphis on Saturday night.

entry_title: NBA fines Sixers $100K for 'inconsistent' statements on Joel Embiid's injury status
entry_summary: The NBA has fined the Philadelphia 76ers $100,000 for making "inconsistent" statements about the health of their All-Star center, who has been out with what the team is calling left knee management.

entry_summary: Nick recaps the Los Angeles Lakers opening night with Bronny and LeBron James playing together.

entry_title: Klay Thompson scores 22 points, breaks franchise 3-point record in Mavs debut
entry_summary: Luka Doncic had 28 points and 10 rebounds, Klay Thompson scored 22 in his Dallas debut, and the Mavericks beat the San Antonio Spurs 120-109 in the opener for both teams.

entry_title: Suns set to contend with Beal, Durant, and Booker, but can Clippers thrive without Kawhi? | Speak
entry_summary: Paul Pierce evaluates the Phoenix Suns potential as title contenders with stars Bradley Beal, Kevin Durant, and Devin Booker leading the charge. He acknowledges their impressive 45-win season last year, despite being swept in the playoffs. However, Pierce expresses concern over the Los Angeles Clippers ability to compete without Kawhi Leonard.

entry_title: NBA is investigating Joel Embiid's playing status after he misses season opener
entry_summary: The NBA is now investigating why Joel Embiid didn't play in the 76ers' nationally televised season-opener against the Bucks.

entry_title: LeBron and Bronny James make history as first father-son duo to play together in the NBA | Speak
entry_summary: Paul Pierce, Keyshawn Johnson and Joy Taylor share their thoughts on LeBron and Bronny James making history as first father-son duo to play in the NBA.

entry_title: Lakers win season opener vs. T-Wolves, What did opening night tell you? | Speak
entry_summary: The Los Angeles Lakers win in season opener. Anthony Davis finished with 36 points and 16 rebounds. Paul Pierce shares his thoughts - "You have to play through Anthony Davis. He's your best player on both sides of the court."

entry_title: Can Jayson Tatum win MVP and lead the Celtics to a championship? | Speak
entry_summary: Paul Pierce dives into the MVP conversation, asserting that many MVP winners rarely secure a championship in the same year. Despite this, he acknowledges Jayson Tatum's elite status, calling him an MVP-caliber player and possibly the best American-born talent in the NBA today.

entry_summary: Check out this article for a complete list of teams who have made the most 3-pointers in a single NBA game.

entry_title: Colin's Bold NBA predictions: Lakers miss playoffs, Giannis asks for trade, Luka scores 80 | The Herd
entry_summary: Colin Cowherd shares his NBA predictions for the 2024-25 season, including the Los Angeles Lakers missing the playoffs, Luka Dončić scoring 80 points in one game and Giannis Antetokounmpo requesting a trade from the Milwaukee Bucks.
